alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:56PM EST until December 20 at 9:18AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Montague. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Flooding of low lying areas outside of levee protection is likely from Greenfield through Hatfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 29.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday was 29.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 30.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.5 feet on 01/11/1935. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
